summary: This is a formal request from the U.S. Department of Justice to the United Kingdom for expedited mutual legal assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The request seeks school records, a birth certificate, and travel/passport records for a cooperating minor victim to corroborate her testimony about being groomed and abused by Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein in London in the mid-1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution. The document details her alleged role in assisting Jeffrey Epstein in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls from approximately 1994 to 2004.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the principal perpetrator of the sexual abuse of minor girls. The investigation into his conduct led to the ongoing case against Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with, assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's sexual abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and arranging travel for victims.
Maxwell allegedly groomed and befriended a minor victim in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused the minor victim after Maxwell introduced them.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with conspiracy to sexually traffic minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained pending trial.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell in New York.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and has been detained pending trial since that date.

events.title: Maxwell Superseding Indictment
events.description: A grand jury returned a Superseding Indictment with additional charges against Maxwell, including sex trafficking conspiracy and perjury.

events.title: Grooming of Victim in London
events.description: The period during which Maxwell allegedly groomed and befriended a minor victim in London, England, and introduced her to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell Trial
events.description: The trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on this date, creating urgency for the evidence request.

keyFacts: The U.S. was urgently seeking UK records (school, birth, travel) for a cooperating minor victim to corroborate her testimony for the upcoming Maxwell trial.
The victim's account details Maxwell grooming her in London in 1994-1995, introducing her to Epstein, and encouraging massages that led to sexual abuse.
The investigation into Epstein continued after his death, leading to Maxwell's indictment for her role in facilitating his abuse of minors.
The Superseding Indictment charges Maxwell with conspiracy, transportation of minors, enticement, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury.
The document emphasizes the need for confidentiality to protect the victim/witness and prevent witness intimidation.
